data_start_values.value: Change in water-use efficiency over time (%)

SDG_GOAL: Goal 6: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
SDG_TARGET: Target 6.4: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 6.4.1: Change in water-use efficiency over time
STAT_CONC_DEF:
Change in water use efficiency over time (CWUE): The change in the ratio of the value added to the volume of water use, over time.

Water-use efficiency measured as the ratio of dollar value added to the volume of water used. It considers water use by all economic activities, with a focus on agriculture, industry and the service sectors.

Following the United Nations International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities ISIC 4 coding, sectors are defined as:
1. agriculture; forestry; fishing (ISIC A), hereinafter “agriculture”;
2. mining and quarrying; manufacturing; electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply; constructions (ISIC B, C, D and F), hereinafter “MIMEC”;
3. all the service sectors (ISIC E and ISIC G-T), hereinafter “services
DATA_COMP:
Data are from the UN Water database. Select Country=Canada, under Indicator to display, click on "Water availability and use", then on 6.4.1 Change in water-use efficiency over time.

Change in water use efficiency (CWUE) (in %) = [(WUE in time t - WUE in time t-1)/(WUE in time t-1)]*100
